body.name: Consew CES-85AF Gravity Feed Commercial Electric Steam Iron Complete Set
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 17 hrs 23 mins
features: Brand New Consew Gravity Feed Electric Steam Iron Set CES-85AF.
Complete Set with teflon shoe, demineralizer, water bottle, hose and iron rest.

Industrial Gravity Feed Steam Iron (IGFSI) is a self-contained ironing system that does not require a boiler. It utilizes a seperate water bottle that must be suspended above your working surface. It operates similarly to a household iron but has the separate water storage for longer amounts of pressing and is a heavier professional style iron.

Features : Convenient soft-touch button switch & rotary heat dial Heat shield for added protection during long use U/L approved thermostat High quality steam distribution Hard anodized aluminum sole plate Comfortable urethane handle
Specifications : Electricity : 110 ~ 120 Volts Wattage : 1000 Watts Weight : 4.6 lbs. (2.1Kgs.) Base Size : 8-1/4" x 4-3/4" (209mm x 120mm)

reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Iron does not work - do not buy from this seller
reviews.reviewText: After 8 months of use the solenoid did not work and one year after purchase there is no power. Do not buy from this seller as they were not helpful and neither was Consew. I have owned many Consew machines for my business and am shocked at what a negative experience this has been.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not all gravity feed irons are created equal
reviews.reviewText: I had a gravity feed iron which I have used for years, and I broke (completely my fault). I was in the middle of several projects, and decided to take what I could get on Prime. This iron has been a real disappointment. The steam is very uneven. You press the button and nothing happens, then the next time you press the button it sputters and spits. I didn't even know a gravity feed iron COULD spit. Because there is no water in the iron itself, I've never had that happen. Also, the handle on this iron gets so hot that it burns you. One of the pluses of a gravity feed iron is that it doesn't have an automatic shut-off, so if you're sewing all day, you can leave it on and not have to wait for it to heat back up so you can press your seams. After being on about 30 minutes, you have be very careful where you touch the handle. If you don't have your hand way out at the end, you will burn yourself. As a man with fairly good sized hands, that's a problem. I have ordered a new iron like my previous iron (not on Amazon-they don't sell that brand) and will anxiously await its arrival. Can't wait to replace this, and terribly disappointed that its money down the drain.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This iron was good when was workingAfter 5 months of use it broke downSteam comes out on its own even though the steam button is not pressedThis is the second iron that I got and happened the same thing

reviews.reviewText: This was a replacement for a similar model that I had for 10 years. Sadly this one was purchased December 22 and now it won’t heat.
